reference.shortdesc: The mapresources element serves as an intuitive location for map authors to place objects with processing-role set to resource-only, for example, key definitions and subject scheme maps

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The mapresources element is specialized from topicref. It is defined in the map group module.

section.title: Attributes
section.p: The following attributes are available on this element: , (with a narrowed definition of href, given below), (with the exclusion of chunk, collection-type, locktitle and a narrowed definition of processing-role, given below), keys, keyref, and the attributes defined below.

dlentry.dd: Points to the resource that is represented by the topicref element. See for detailed information on supported values and processing implications. References to DITA content cannot be below the topic level: that is, you cannot reference individual elements inside a topic. References to content other than DITA topics should use the format attribute to identify the kind of resource being referenced.
The default value for processing-role is set to resource-only. Otherwise, the definition matches the one in .

example.title: Examples
example.p: This section provides examples of how the mapresources element can be used.

fig.title: Specifying resource-only objects in an intuitive location in a book map
fig.p: The following code sample illustrate how the mapresources element can group references to key definitions, subject schemes, and other resources in a bookmap:
fig.codeblock: <bookmap> <booktitle> <mainbooktitle>Test bookmap</mainbooktitle> </booktitle> <mapresources> <mapref href="key-definitions.ditamap"/> <mapref href="subject-scheme.ditamap" type="subjectscheme"/> <topicref href="cover-page.dita outputclass="cover-page"/> </mapresources> ... </bookmap>
fig.p: Note that this example illustrates that mapresources can be used to make topics available for resource-only processing. In this scenario, the company uses a processor that uses content contained in the cover-page.dita file to generate a PDF cover page.

fig.title: Specifying resource-only objects in a map
fig.p: The following code sample shows a map that contains information for a specific model of a controller. This map is referenced in an omnibus publication that contains information for an entire family of controllers.
fig.codeblock: <map keyscope="model-XNP09"> <title>Model XNP09</title> <mapresources> <keydef keys="model-illustration" href="model-XNP09.png" format="png"/> <keydef keys="remove-cover" href="remove-cover-XNP09.png" format="png"/> </mapresources> <topicref href="model-overview.dita/> <topicref href="installing.dita"/> <topicref href="uninstalling.dita/> ... </map>
